revised_title: William Sawney Bisat: A Pioneering Geologist and Civil Engineer
tldr: William Sawney Bisat was a self-taught geologist and civil engineer who made significant contributions to understanding the Carboniferous rocks of Yorkshire and the Pleistocene ice deposits in northern England. His work helped improve the accuracy of rock-sequence correlation and provided insights into the palaeogeography and environmental conditions of the time. Bisat's research on goniatite faunas and his dedication to local scientific societies made him a respected figure in the field of geology.
